block.p: Lauren Brooke Slater, a daughter of Cheryl Post Slater and Dr. James A. Slater of New Canaan, Conn., was married last evening in Darien, Conn., to Robert John Gibbons, the son of Mary Jane Gibbons and Robert P. Gibbons of Tenafly, N.J. Rabbi Mark Lipson officiated at the Country Club of Darien.

Mrs. Gibbons, 29, was until June the co-chairwoman of the English department at St. David's School, the private school in New York, where she also taught fifth- and eighth-grade English. She is now a reading and writing specialist at Greenwich (Conn.) Country Day School. She graduated with distinction from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and received a master's degree in curriculum and teaching from Columbia University Teachers College. Her father, an internist, is a partner in the New Canaan Medical Group, a private practice. Her mother is a consultant on American crafts in New Canaan.

Lauren Brooke Slater, a daughter of Cheryl Post Slater and Dr. James A. Slater of New Canaan, Conn., was married last evening in Darien, Conn., to Robert John Gibbons, the son of Mary Jane Gibbons and Robert P. Gibbons of Tenafly, N.J. Rabbi Mark Lipson officiated at the Country Club of Darien.

Mrs. Gibbons, 29, was until June the co-chairwoman of the English department at St. David's School, the private school in New York, where she also taught fifth- and eighth-grade English. She is now a reading and writing specialist at Greenwich (Conn.) Country Day School. She graduated with distinction from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and received a master's degree in curriculum and teaching from Columbia University Teachers College. Her father, an internist, is a partner in the New Canaan Medical Group, a private practice. Her mother is a consultant on American crafts in New Canaan.

Mr. Gibbons, 31, is a managing director and investment banker at American Corporate Services, a New York company that specializes in mergers and acquisitions. He graduated from Muhlenberg College and received an M.B.A. from New York University. His father is a restructuring consultant in Tenafly, helping financially troubled companies, and is a trustee of the United States Bankruptcy Court in Trenton and Newark.
